text: $MSFT HAVING ITS WORST DAY IN ~5 YEARS

Every new AI generation requires more HBM per GPU which means more revenue per chip for $MU. 

Just yesterday, $TSLA unveiled Cortex 2, a massive AI compute cluster to train Optimus humanoid robots and power an end-to-end neural network for Cybercab autonomy. 

The AI economy is becoming memory-first which helps explain why Micron stock is up ~5x over the past year.

Nobody wants to live on SaaS Ave in 2026

This is evidence that $META AI investments are monetizing. 

In advertising, you usually get either more volume or higher prices but rarely both. Meta is seeing both right now (impressions are up and prices are up) which only happens when ads are actually converting better and advertisers are getting real value.

AI is enabling Meta to monetize through the unsexy but highly profitable work of making ads perform better.

$META is becoming one of the clearest application-layer winners in the AI economy with AI already driving real engagement, ad performance & revenue acceleration.

At 17x earnings, the market is still pricing it like a legacy ad biz while the AI flywheel is just getting started.
$TSLA TO ACQUIRE $2B OF XAI PREFERRED STOCK
$NVDA, $MSFT & $AMZN are reportedly in talks to invest up to $60B in OpenAI.

Elon says Optimus faces no serious competition outside China.

The hard parts are hands, real-world AI, and scaling production and $TSLA believes it has all three

Elon says chips are the binding constraint on $TSLA long-term growth.

Even best-case supply from $TSM & $MU isn‚Äôt enough pushing Tesla toward a domestic terafab

$MSFT Q3 OUTLOOK

‚Ä¢ Revenue $81.3B (+16% YoY)
‚Ä¢ Azure +38% with Cloud gross margin ~65%
‚Ä¢ Capex down sequentially

Microsoft pulls back after management said Azure growth remains capacity constrained and not all incremental capex will be directed to Azure.
$TSLA CFO says 2026 capex will be in excess of $20B making it a major investment year more than double 2025 levels

Betting to replace Powell, here are the latest probabilities:

Rieder 36%
Warsh 26%
Waller 17%
"Door #5" 14%
Hassett 7%

When no one is trading above 40%, it means the race to succeed Powell is wide open... even "Door #5" (someone else) is now in play.

Question for reporters in the Fed presser.

Are you afraid to ask difficult or probing questions to the Chairman out of fear that Michelle Smith, the head of the Fed press office, will either exclude you or not call on you in future pressers?

Ok, one potential important statement by Powell

*POWELL: GROWTH IN LABOR SUPPLY HAS COME ESSENTIALLY TO A HALT

Is he saying now the labor break-even rate is zero?  At least follow up on this. 

It's probably the most important thing he said so far

Bessent this morning

*BESSENT: HAVEN'T NARROWED DOWN OR EXPANDED POOL FOR FED CHAIR

Translation: Waller still has a chance.

If he does not dissent (in favor of cut) ...

*BESSENT, WE NARROWED THE POOL FOR FED CHAIR TO THREE

Meta $META guided for $115-135 billion in capex for 2026, up 73% YoY at midpoint, and more than 3X the $39.2 billion it spent in just 2024.

$NVDA $AVGO

Microsoft's $MSFT fiscal Q2 capex was $37.5 billion, up 66% YoY, with roughly two-thirds for short-lived assets, primarily GPUs and CPUs, to support Azure demand. 

$NVDA $AMZN $GOOG

Meta $META reported Q4 revenue up 23.8% YoY to $59.89 billion, ahead of estimates for $58.47 billion, while EPS was $8.88, ahead of estimates for $8.22.

For Q1, Meta guided for revenue of $53.5-56.5 billion, up 30% YoY at midpoint and ahead of estimates for $51.47 billion. 

$NVDA $AVGO

ASML $ASML reported a record ‚Ç¨13.2 billion ($15.8 billion) in bookings in Q4, nearly double the estimate of ‚Ç¨6.85 billion.

EUV machines accounted for more than half of bookings at ‚Ç¨7.4 billion.

$TSM $AMAT $LRCX $NVDA

Microsoft $MSFT reported $81.3 billion in revenue in fiscal Q2, up 17% YoY, while adjusted EPS rose 24% to $4.14, beating estimates for $80.3 billion and $3.92.

Azure revenue grew 39% YoY and 38% in constant currency, a 1 point deceleration from Q1.

üì∫ POST-EARNINGS PLAN FOR $META, $MSFT & $TSLA

Earnings reactions were mixed across $META, $MSFT, and $TSLA, creating selective trading opportunities. 

$META rewarded preparation with a strong post-guidance gap, while $MSFT sold off and needs time to stabilize before any trade.

$TSLA gapped higher but remains range-bound, making patience key as traders watch whether the gap holds and a clean pivot setup emerges.

No surprises from the Fed, and markets are responding constructively. 

$QQQ is pressing toward a potential breakout after months of consolidation, while $SPY holds key support near highs. 

With the Fed behind us, focus shifts to whether the price can confirm the next leg higher.
$SPX just printed a new ATH at 7002 and futures are +14. We‚Äôll see if early strength builds or fades, using 7002 as our pivot and the 6958/6893 zone as spots to measure active support against.

OpenAI is in talks for a massive funding round that could reach $100B at about a $730B pre-money valuation.

Reportedly, Nvidia could invest up to $30B, Amazon up to $20B, and Microsoft under $10B.

AI didn‚Äôt get crowded by accident.

It got crowded because it worked.

But now leadership is narrower than earnings justify and the next phase of AI may look nothing like the first.
